etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Stamford Raffles (1781–1826), colonial governor and founder of Singapore. Either from Malay rasamala or from its cognate Javanese rasamala (already in Old Javanese)

definitions: A large South-East Asian tree, Altingia excelsa (family Altingiaceae), related to the liquidambars, which yields a heavy timber and a scented resin.
